arm_group.description: Providers in intervention clinics will receive a training followed by telephone coaching and follow-up visits for six months.
Control clinics will receive all intervention materials at the completion of the study.

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary aim of this trial is to test the effectiveness of an intervention to train
      primary care physicians to determine if it leads to decreased parental vaccine hesitancy.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary aim of this trial is to test the effectiveness of an intervention to train
      primary care physicians to determine if it leads to decreased parental vaccine hesitancy.
      The investigators will train primary care teams with an initial training followed by
      telephone coaching and follow-up visits, and assess the outcomes of parental vaccine
      hesitancy (primary) and physician self-efficacy (secondary) at baseline and 6 months.

intervention.description: The intervention design is based on "academic detailing," an effective method of changing physician behavior. The aim of the training is effective communication with parents who are hesitant about childhood vaccinations.

primary_outcome.description: The investigators will contact mothers of newborns in study practices and conduct a telephone survey at two time points: baseline and 6 months. Surveys will assess parental hesitancy, parental trust in provider, and other covariates such as perceived social norms, other sources of information about vaccines, and demographic information.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline in Parental Hesitancy at 6 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed via self-administered surveys of providers in all participating clinics at baseline and 6-months. The investigators will measure physician attitudes, perceived norms, intentions to change behavior, practice characteristics, and physician demographics.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline in Physician Attitudes at 6 months

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
